body: I’ll add to your book list with 'Norwegian Wood' by Haruki Murakami. It’s perfect for anyone who loves stories that mix melancholy with beauty.

For books that bring that melancholic mood, I recommend 'The Catcher in the Rye'. It has that perfect mix of introspection and fleeting moments of clarity. I think it would fit right into the vibe you’re after.
For melancholic books, try 'The Fault in Our Stars'. It’s got that perfect blend of sadness and beauty, and it’ll definitely make you think about life and loss.
I love that recommendation! Murakami has such a way of making melancholy feel beautiful and inviting. It's definitely on my list now!
Catcher in the Rye is a great suggestion! That book always leaves you with so much to think about, like an ache that sticks with you.
